meanings.definition: Forming a very small remnant of something that was once much larger or more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The vestigial tail on the lizard was tiny and barely visible.
meanings.sent2: The vestigial wings of the flightless bird served no purpose.
meanings.sent3: The vestigial button on the old coat was like a tiny decoration.
meanings.sent4: Her vestigial interest in the outdated fashion trend was fading away.
meanings.sent5: The vestigial memory of their childhood adventures lingered in their minds.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a vestige or vestiges.
meanings.sent1: The vestigial ruins of the ancient castle were fascinating to explore.
meanings.sent2: The vestigial traditions of the culture were still practiced by some.
meanings.sent3: The vestigial smell of the campfire clung to his clothes.
meanings.sent4: Her vestigial loyalty to the old company was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The vestigial charm of the historic town attracted many tourists.

meanings.sent1: The appendix is considered a vestigial organ in humans.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study vestigial structures to understand evolution.
meanings.sent3: The vestigial antenna on the robot was a cute design feature.
meanings.sent4: The vestigial tail of the dog wagged happily.
meanings.sent5: The vestigial gills on the fish reminded us of its aquatic ancestors.
